meanings.definition: To claim or seize without justification
meanings.sent1: He was arrogating credit for the team's success.
meanings.sent2: The dictator was arrogating power to himself.
meanings.sent3: The cat was arrogating the sunny spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm arrogated the peaceful atmosphere of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: Her loud voice arrogated attention in the crowded room.

meanings.definition: To assume or demand unwarranted authority
meanings.sent1: The supervisor was arrogating control over every decision.
meanings.sent2: The bully was arrogating dominance over the other students.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was arrogating the role of the teacher in the play.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds arrogated the sky, blocking out the sun.
meanings.sent5: His arrogant behavior arrogated respect from no one.

meanings.definition: To appropriate or take possession of without permission
meanings.sent1: The thief was arrogating valuables from the house.
meanings.sent2: The company was arrogating land for their new building.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was arrogating nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The weeds arrogated the garden, choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The virus arrogated control of the computer system.
